be run as a cluster data warehouse so you have a leader node which is your cql endpoint uh you can connect to it using
jdbc odbc and um the leader node actually is responsible for uh coordinating query
execution across the cluster so your compute nodes uh is where your data is stored and where query processing takes
place and everything's connected by a high performance 10 gbit ethernet non-blocking Network and when you uh
actually issue a query we generate and compile C++ code executed on all the compute nodes in parallel and then bring
the results back to the leader node to be returned to the requesting application uh the compute nodes
themselves we use uh columnar storage for red shift um and this provides benefits in terms of compression but
also in terms of query performance and all the data stored locally and we use
Amazon S3 for bulk data loading and uh also for automatic continuous backups so
you put your data onto S3 issue a copy command and it's loaded in parallel in bulk automatically and um red shift's
Hardware platform uh is optimized for high performance data processing it actually uses an ec2 instance called the
high storage instance and that's available for customers uh to use on EC to if they would like to um the large
node size has 16 terab of compressed data on it and the smaller size uh has
two terabytes and so red shift allows you to start small uh with a 2 terab Data Warehouse and then scale up uh all
the way up to 1.6 pedabytes by um having a 100 of the larger nodes in your
cluster and your cluster is available for reads while you're resizing uh so an operation that uh it's easy for us to do

$3,700 and we also offer uh reservation models so this is where you can commit

question I'm going to point this back to you Angie is um can you clarify what's a
distribution key uh you mentioned that in kind of your key learnings um could
you please uh repeat the question sure it's um what is a distribution key uh so
that is um that is a comment from my DBA so I don't I haven't been directly working with um uh setting up the tables
but Rahul I'm sure can answer that uh yes I can speak to that Sher and Andre
uh so with red shift when you're thinking about a multi-node system uh distribution key is something you define
on your tables uh that tells red shift how to spread your data across all the nodes in your
cluster and uh the goal with a distri with Distributing data is you do it when
you're defining your table and as uh as Angie mentioned it's one distribution key per table and once you've set it um
you'd have to create a new table and copy your data from one to the other to change it but um the reason to choose a
distribution key is if your uh schema requires a lot and queries require a lot of joins uh distribution keys can ensure
that your joins are located on uh the same node so think for example um if you
have information about an ad in multiple different tables if you use the ad ID as the distribution key then all of the
data for a given ad from all the tables will be on the same node and so when you run joins those nodes are local those
joins are local and can run uh much faster than if we're shipping data across the network between nodes uh our
large 8xl nodes can deliver over 2 gabt per second of scan rate and so uh local
joins are something to strive for and then the second piece around distribution is you want to ensure that
your data distribution is as even as possible uh because that way all of your nodes will do an equal amount of work
and you won't get uh bottlenecks in the

additional queries will get cued and so um these are queries that are executing
simultaneously it's not really over any time frame per se and um the way
customers manage this is essentially we have uh a workload management capability which allows customers to Define
query execution cues and then assign users and queries to those cues and so they're able to take advantage of uh um
essentially ensuring that the queries that need to get completed get completed and so we definitely um document this in
our best practices and also provide guidance on how to tune uh tune your workload so you're not uh affected by
this limit uh but it does mean that uh for example uh you know if you have tens of thousands of users you're not going
to want them to directly query red shift um you'll need some form of intermediate layer in
